titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Jacques Loeb papers, Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research Scientific Staff FA176

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-03-14 00:24:26 -0400.

change.item: Paper finding aid converted to EAD/XML by AureXus in 2010. Imported into the Archvists’ Toolkit by Becky Robbins.

did.unittitle: Jacques Loeb papers, Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research Scientific Staff
did.physdesc: 2 boxes including volume of Osterhout article; 9 volumes

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Jacques Loeb (1859-1924) physician and physiologist, Member of The Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research, director of Experimental Biology from 1910 until his death in 1924.
Member and Honorary Member of numerous Societies.

eventgrp.event: Ph. D, Sc. D. University of Berlin
Assistant in Physiology, University of Würzburg
Assistant in Physiology, University of Strasbourg
Associate in Biology, Bryn Mawr College
Associate Professor in physiology and Experimental Biology University of Chicago
Associate Professor in physiology, University of Chicago
Professor in physiology, University of Chicago
Professor of physiology, University of California
Honorary D. Sc, Cambridge, Eng.; Honorary M.D., Geneva; Honorary Ph. D., Leipzig
Member, Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research, New York

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Administrative correspondence, biographical articles, photographs, bibliography, and collected reprints.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

did.unittitle: Bibliography of the Published Writings of Jacques Loeb, compiled by Nina Kobelt. Typescript and printed copy
Printed obituaries and biographical memoirs

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes Russian translation of W.J.V. Osterhout's memoir.

did.unittitle: Program for unveiling of memorial tablet, Marine Biological Laboratory, Woods Hole, Massachusetts
"Jacques Loeb Memorial Supplement" The Collecting Net
"Academic appointments held..."
Photocopies of obituaries for Mrs. Loeb (d. 20 August 1951)
Portraits: by Louis Schmidt (multiple copies) no neg. in folder
Portraits: Undated, standing, with hands in pockets. 2 copies, plus enlargement of head. No neg. in folder
Portraits: by Louis Schmidt. Multiple copies, no neg. in folder
Informal snapshots, many taken at Woods Hole, most undated
Miscellaneous photos

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes 2 photos of Leo Loeb, one dated 1921; print of Jacques Loeb Memorial Tablet [Woods Hole], 1928.

did.unittitle: Correspondence
Loeb/Simon Flexner, 13 (?) Jun 1906, re possible position for Prof. H. Borrattass of Göttingen, a "first class man" in nerve physiology and pathology; Flexner/Loeb 27 Jul 1906, reply
Flexner/Loeb, 12 Oct 1909, re possibility of Loeb coming to the Rockefeller Institute; Loeb/Flexner, 14 Oct 1909, will seriously consider offer
Loeb/Flexner, re "call to Europe"
Hermann M. Biggs/Flexner, re Loeb
Flexner/Theobald Smith, 20 Nov 1909, re Loeb; Smith/Flexner, 23 Nov 1909, reply
Flexner/Loeb, "delighted" Loeb will be able to come to New York for conference

Loeb/Flexner [Hotel Belmont, NY stationery], thanks for Flexner's kindness; requests Flexner obtain information about sources of material, from New York Aquarium or possibly "Morgan, Wilson, or Davenport." Flexner/Loeb, 22 Dec 1909, reply
Loeb/Flexner, telegram: "letter received offer Generous shall probably accept letter follows"
Loeb/Flexner, thanks for offer, would accept "at once if it was not for Budapest"
Flexner/Loeb, writing on behalf of Executive Committee of the Rock. Inst, re appointment. Typed copy marked "Not sent"
Loeb/Flexner, telegram: "Accept with thanks offer of headship of department of Experimental biology Rockefeller Institute"
Loeb/Flexner, re possible visit to Plymouth, England to study methods of raising marine larvae
Loeb/Flexner, returned from Pacific Grove where he has been working on tissue extracts; postscript re Budapest
Loeb/Flexner, psychiatrist Adolph Meyer is "pleased" with Loeb's decision; has begun to raise fungi on cow dung "which I am sure can be had in the neighborhood of New York"
Flexner/Loeb, has received a note from Davenport re sea-urchins at Cold Spring Harbor
Loeb/Flexner, re Hardolph Wasteneys

Loeb/Flexner, needs more space at Woods Hole; Loeb would like to work at the Fish Commission "if it were not that my friends at the MBL [Marine Biological Laboratory] might take offence at it..". Flexner/Loeb, 22 Mar 1910, reply
Loeb/Flexner, enclosing list of apparatus. Flexner will "feel gratified to see, that I intend having 2 kymographs. I am not as bad as my reputation - I may even vivisect"
Loeb/Flexner, enclosing chemical list. "It is very important for any work to have the purest chemicals obtainable in the market"
Loeb/Flexner, Wasteneys will be arriving in New York to prepare Loeb's solutions and apparatus for Woods Hole
Loeb/[James] Norris, request for blood serum. "There is no slaughter house here or in the vicinity..."
Loeb/Flexner, possibility of invitation to Dr. [Otto] Warburg, who "has published a series of very brilliant papers concerning the oxydations in the animal cell..."
Loeb/Flexner, re fellowship for Dr. Wolfgang Ewald
Loeb/Jerome D. Greene, re possibility of grant to Professor Bechhold of Dr. Ehrlich's laboratory, to equip Department of Colloidal Chemistry; Greene/ Loeb, 29 Apr-1912, re Rock. Found
Loeb/Greene, 3 May 1912, re foundation of an International Institute for the Investigation of the Effects of Alcohol; Greene/Loeb, 7 May 1912, re Rock. Found
Greene/Loeb, re Edward Forbes at Woods Hole
Loeb/Greene, report of work with Dr. Beutner
"Report of the Department of Experimental Biology," typescript
Loeb/Flexner, re Frank Bancroft's return to California
Loeb/[Kornel] v. Körösy, re possibility of v. Körösy working with Loeb on tropisms
[Henry James Jr.] /Loeb, re room at Woods Hole for Dr. [Edward] Uhlenhut
Loeb/Flexner, re appointment of McKeen Cattell as summer assistant
Loeb/James, quotes telegram L. sent to President [Woodrow] Wilson
Loeb/James, re work of Madame [Danchakoff]
James/Loeb, requests scientific report "intelligible" to the Board of Trustees
James/Loeb, re [John] Northrop
James/Loeb, re appointment of Mary Andrews
Loeb/Edric B. Smith, re death of frogs
James/Loeb, requests scientific report for Board of Trustees
Loeb/James, needs place to raise flies for feeding of frogs
James/Loeb, appointment of Dr. [Florence H]. Francis; re Dr. Raymond Pearl
Loeb/James, comments on war
James/Loeb, re appointment of Dr. Carl B. Dermby
Loeb/James, re Mr. [Moses] Kunitz
Loeb/Flexner, re American Journal of Physiology
Loeb/Flexner, 14 Apr 1919 re proposed budget
Ph. Rummel/J.P. Warbasse, 8 Jun 1919 and 7 Nov 1919, re Loeb and Socialism
Loeb/Edric B. Smith, re Miss Helen McNaught
Loeb/Flexner, 1 and 11 Dec 1919, re B.M. Allen; Allen/Loeb, [1919] (copy) Loeb/Flexner, 25 Jan 1921, re change in division's name from "Experimental Biology" to "General Physiology"
Loeb/Flexner, re Miss [Elizabeth] Brakeley and importance of maintaining good relations with chemical laboratory at Columbia [University]
A.J. Gelarie/Loeb, letter of complaint
Loeb/James, (copy) re Gelarie
Loeb/Flexner, re letter from [Frank R.] Lillie
Smith/Loeb, re appointment of David Hitchcock
Loeb/Flexner, request for helper to prepare protein solutions
F. Foerster/Loeb, (translation and copy), re Loeb consent to give address at meeting of Bunsen Association in Leipsic

Loeb/Flexner, decision not to go abroad because 1) wife's poor health and 2) Wilhelm Ostwald and [Walther] Nernst are other speakers on program and Loeb's attendance "would have pained the French and Belgian scientists"

Loeb/Flexner, re 1) visit of Ivan P. Pavlov and son at Woods Hole; 2) discussion with Pavlov about P. Lasareff; 3) receipt of letter from Prof. O. Warburg re [Otto] Meyerhof and anti-Semitism; Flexner/Loeb, 5 Jul 1923, reply
P. Lasareff/Loeb, (copy), re proposed trip to American; paragraph on "big geophysical work on the investigation of the Kursk magnetic anomaly"
Richard Lorenz/Loeb, (in German), re Loeb's theory and Lorenz's own work on strong electrolytes
Loeb/Flexner, recommends visits of P. Lasareff, Otto Warburg, and Richard Lorenz
B.A. Younker/Loeb, attorney on behalf of A.J. Gelarie

A. Einstein/Loeb, (copy and translation), re possibility of support from Rockefeller Institute for theoretical assistant for work on general relativity; pleased to hear of R.I. support of O. Warburg; brief comments on situation in Europe. [2 p. listing of Contents of Albert Einstein file, International Education Board Archives]
Selected condolence letters
J. Stanley Gardiner
[Adolph] Von Harnack
Baron D.S. Kitasato
E. Rutherford
Otto Meyerhof
A. Einstein, (copy)
Otto Meyerhof, (copy)
Leo Loeb

Svante Arrhenius, (copy)
O. Herzog
I.P. Pavlov
"Jacques Loeb" by John H. Northrop, carbon typescript
Prof. Rona, (extract and copy), condolence letter
E.P. Lyon, (copy), condolence letter
Flexner/Mrs. Loeb, "Memorial Minute to Jacques Loeb"
Frank R. Lillie/Flexner, re Loeb memorial tablet for Marine Biological
Laboratory, Woods Hole, photograph
Thos. C. Corner/Flexner, re portrait of Dr. Loeb
Robert F. Loeb/Herbert S. Gasser, telegram re death of Mrs. Jacques Loeb
File on Leo Loeb
Flexner/ L. Loeb, re L. Loeb's "conflict with Dr. Gaylord."; L.
Loeb/Flexner, replies

L. Loeb/Board of Trustees of the R.I.M.R., application for grant of $600 "to carry out certain investigations in the growth of tissues and allied problems and in the coagulation of the blood"; Flexner/Loeb, 14 Jan 1908, reply
L. Loeb/L. Emmett Holt, report of scientific work
L. Loeb/Board of Scientific Directors of the R.I.M.R., report of scientific work; Flexner/Loeb, 1 Dec 1909, reply
Correspondence re reprints
Isaac A. Abt/ Flexner, re director for reorganized Michael Reese Hospital and the Morris Institute for Medical Research; Flexner/Abt, 21 Dec 1914, recommends Loeb
Flexner-L. Loeb correspondence., re temporary transfer of L. Loeb's work to Institute; 1 letter, J. Loeb/Flexner, ca Dec 1914, re L. Loeb and position at Michael Reese Hospital
Short Register, Jacques Loeb Papers, Library of Congress, Manuscript Division
Jacques Loeb/William J. Crozier, marked "Confidential" re founding of a Journal of General Physiology

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Also in folder: photocopy of letter and envelope from Mrs. Garn to Dr. Jules Hirsch.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Addition. Gift of Priscilla Crozier Garn. Transmitted to Archives via Mrs. Sonya W. Mirsky, 25 March 1986.

did.unittitle: Photocopy and clippings of articles in newspapers which appeared at the time of Dr. Loeb's death.
Magazine articles about Jacques Loeb
Stockbridge, Frank. "Creating Life in the Laboratory" Cosmopolitan Magazine 774-781
Serviss, Garrett P. "Artificial Creation of Life" Cosmopolitan Magazine 459-468
De Kruif, Paul. "Jacques Loeb, the Mechanist" Harper Magazine 183-190 (2 cop)

Garrey, W.E. "Memorial to Jacques Loeb" Science 59 (1925) 198
"Honorary Degrees at Yale University" Science 57 (1923) 11
Osterhout, W.J.V. "Jacques Loeb, Biographical Sketch" Journal of General Physiology 8 (1928) ix-xcii
"Jacques Loeb" JGP 6 (1924) unpaged (2 cop)
"Memorial to Jacques Loeb" by Levene, Osterhout, Flexner, Lillie. Proceeding of the Society for Experimental Biology and Medicine 21 (1924) i-xiv (2 copies)
Williams, H.S. "Our Twelve Great Scientists. IX. Dr. Jacques Loeb" Technical World Magazine 761-765
Flexner, Simon, "Jacques Loeb and his Period" Science 66 (1927) 333-337
"Jacques Loeb" Medical News JAMA 82 (1924) 722, 563
"Obituary: Jacques Loeb" Medical Journal and Record 267
Herbst, Curt "Jacques Loeb; a short survey of his life-work" Die Naturwissenschaften the original in German with an English translation

did.physloc: Removed to the RAC library 1988 August 9.

Loeb, Jacques. Regeneration from a physico-chemical viewpoint. New York, McGraw-Hill (v. 9)
